lines: Previously, on the Adventure Zone...

speaker: Magic Brian
lines: I’m going to die now...

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you don't see Jenkins anymore, he is gone, he has been deposited out of the back of the train. You hear him go,

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Smell ya laterrr...

speaker: Griffin
lines: And it is Maarvy, the only surviving member of the Hammerhead gang. You bring the ax down on him. He spins a full 360 degrees --

speaker: Travis
lines: Is he dead?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then he falls to the ground dead.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Through that window you can see what appears to be a pretty large, glass, cylindrical fuse which illuminates whenever this thing talks.

speaker: Noelle
lines: My, my name is Noelle.

speaker: Travis
lines: I might have just figured out what those fuses are for.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see three shapes appear. One is sort of massively built, kind of gorilla-like; another is much more slender, with what looks like a cannon for an arm; another one is very short and has what appears to be a bunch of wires sticking out of it.

speaker: Maarvy
lines: Oh my God, I can't believe it's you guys!

speaker: Magic Brian
lines: Oh yes, this is going to be a lovely little rematch, isn't it?

speaker: Jenkins
lines: That's right, motherfuckers, it's time for round two.

speaker: Announcer
lines: Can our heroes claim victory once again against their old nemeses? I don't know, I haven't listened yet! Don't spoil it for me! It's the Adventure Zone!

lines: "Déjà Vu" by Mort Garson (full song on YouTube)]

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think we should kick things off with a little bit of initiative. I think we should take initiative in this new podcast episode we're recording.

lines: I'm excited, this is my first time rolling my new dice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What are they, whalebone?

speaker: Travis
lines: No, I got a beautiful translucent green emerald kind of thing. [rolls]

lines: Aw, now they got stank on them!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You got that elephant dick bone...carved--

speaker: Travis
lines: And I rolled... a 15! Good start!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Good work, dice!

speaker: Clint
lines: I rolled a 15, but I roll another one.

speaker: Travis
lines: That's 17 total for me.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh. Right. I rolled a 15, plus... nothing.

speaker: Justin
lines: It's 12 for cha'boy.

lines: Huh?

speaker: Justin
lines: 12... for cha'boy.

lines: Cha'boy gets 12... I just wrote 12. That's not your name, your name's Taako.

lines: Yeah. Who- All right, okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: How are you guys doing, while I roll four different initiatives?

speaker: Travis
lines: Good, good.

speaker: Justin
lines: I think you can just round up, in the rules, the official rules, you just round-- average them, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sure, why not. So first in the order... well, before we do anything, these robots are just kind of cackling maniacally at you?

speaker: Travis
lines: Mmhm. I cackle right back! A backle! Hahahahahaha!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Now you're having a cackle battle?

speaker: Travis
lines: A cack-off.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The- the one with a cannon for an arm says,

speaker: Magic Brian
lines: I've gotta say, I am so psyched for this rematch. I have been looking forward to this for, well, since I was vanquished. And I gotta say, I'm so glad to be here with you two bros! My two main men, Jenkins and Maarvy! I'm just so psyched to have this opportunity to whoop some, to whoop, to whoop their rudey-poo asses with you! So, um, let's just have a good clean fight, and may the best robot win, I suppose!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Magic B?

speaker: Magic Brian
lines: Yes?

speaker: Clint
lines: Break!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Are- are you- are you a ghost in the machine?

speaker: Magic Brian
lines: It would seem that way. You kicked me very good. I remember the following. I cast a magic missile at you, Taako, and then you cast one back at me, and our friendship, our budding friendship was betrayed. I thought that we might have a good thing going, and I--

speaker: Griffin
lines: He reaches, well, he can't reach into his pocket.

speaker: Magic Brian
lines: If I was still living, I would have reached into my pocket and shown you, I had a wedding invitation for you to come to my marriage ceremony.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oooh. Awkward.

speaker: Magic Brian
lines: And instead of RSVPing to it, you murdered me.

speaker: Magnus
lines: What's death like?

speaker: Magic Brian
lines: It's pretty chill. You go there and you just kind of float around in a big pool made up of like, the sort of collective memories of everyone who's ever lived. It's like-- it's pretty chill actually. But I prefer living, and you know, I was so close to getting my hands on that sweet, sweet Phoenix Fire Gauntlet, so, um, you know, Daddy's gotta get his.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I mean, you guys could just go away... now you've got these new robot bodies. We don't have to fight and kill you again.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: As good as that sounds-- I would love to get back to my usual sort of M.O., my daily routine... I have a beautiful garden that I need to go back and tend to, I have some--

speaker: Magnus
lines: [sucks in air through his teeth] Oh...

speaker: Jenkins
lines: ---some begonias that I--

speaker: Magnus
lines: [strained] Oh, no.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: What's wrong?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh, nothing, your garden is great.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: How would you know how my-- oh, you've been tending to it since you murdered me?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yep. Totally.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: It seems like the least you could do, after getting my ass thrown off the back of a moving train, is see to my plants and my begonias and my fruits and my lilies.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yep. They're all fine.

speaker: Taako
lines: Are we fighting or what?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jenkins says, uh,

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Oh, yeah, we can-- let's move on to that. Cause I'm actually--

speaker: Taako
lines: I feel like, listen, I'm not- I’m not here to dictate the narrative, but I feel like we've really explored your individual arcs pretty thoroughly. I'd like to get to the part where I shoot you in the chest with an acid arrow.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: It's too bad that you're going last in the initiative order, then.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jenkins actually goes first.

speaker: Travis
lines: He beat a 17?! Horse apples.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, Jenkins kicked ass. Jenkins is this little robot, kind of spherical... he kind of looks like a Fryguy a little bit, except that he has all these individually moving, waving wires. And then his fuse is sort of embedded in the middle of it, and you can see it behind a little circular window. His fuse starts to glow really brightly and some sparks start to shoot off of all those different wires that are poking out of his spherical body, and this weird wave and kind of like a, a supersonic sound comes out of him, and I'm gonna need all of you to roll a Wisdom saving throw.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, Griffin, real quick before I do that. Would the Shield of Memories... (Griffin Yeah.) does this count as robots, which I have told the shield about before?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, this would count as robots.

speaker: Justin
lines: 3 for me.

lines: Oh my Jesus, Justin!

lines: Yeah, not good.

speaker: Clint
lines: 23 for me.

speaker: Travis
lines: 12 for me.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Holy shit. Okay, uh... the good news--

speaker: Travis
lines: 12 is good, it's in the top 50%!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. The good news is that Merle and Carey cleared their saving rolls. The spell didn't seem to have any effect on Noelle at all. The bad news is that Taako and Magnus, you have been Confused.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, what else is new?

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is a fun spell and we're gonna resolve it when we get to your turns. In fact, let's go ahead and get to the resolution right now, because Magnus, you're up next. Before you do anything, my friend, I need you to roll 1d10.

lines: That's a 10.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh shit, okay, you can act and move normally.

lines: Yeah! What was the deal? What was that trying to do?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, let's not ruin it. Let's not ruin the surprise.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay! Alright, cool. I'm going to charge the gorilla one. [Griffin Okay.] And I'm gonna try to axe into that panel in the front with the fuse in it. So yeah, I guess I'll just like two-handed Railsplitter that shit.

speaker: Travis
lines: That is not good. That was a critical miss.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you bring your axe down, you sort of do a horizontal hard chop, and that glass is made of way way way way sturdier stuff than you thought. It's basically like the shit that they put in those big tanks in aquariums. And you don't even leave a scuff mark on that shit.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay well, time to try again with my second attack... [dice] That's a lot better, that's a 19 plus 7, 26.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That's a mis-- no, just kidding, that's a hit. [Travis Son of a bitch.] Yeah, go ahead and roll damage.

speaker: Travis
lines: I'm also going to use Goading Attack when attack lands, dice plus damage equals Wisdom saving throw. On fail, target has Disadvantage on attack not against you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, yeah, I'll do the damage first so... 1d10 plus 6... [dice] That's another ten. So 16 damage, and then [dice] it would have to be a 22 Wisdom saving throw.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well that's-- that simply won't happen. He's-- I mean, Maarvy was not a smart man to begin with, and now he's inhabiting a giant gorilla robot body... [dice] Yeah, no. I, I do not save... [trails off indistinct]

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, so 16 damage, and then Disadvantage on any attack not against me.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, I'm gonna actually demand that you say something to goad him while you hit him.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Hey, do you remember how easy it was to kill you the first time? I plan on doing that again.

lines: Yeah, you chopped me--

speaker: Magnus
lines: [crosstalk] And we threw your body off a cliff! Off a cliff! Your loved ones will never find it. They probably have no idea you're even dead.

lines: [crosstalk] Hold up. Hold up. Hold the phone. Because right now what you just said? That was racist. Because I know me and Barbara sounded alike. But I'm Maarvy.

lines: Uh-huh...?

lines: Bub, listen. Listen, bub. I-- Barbara told me the raw deal you gave him, when we were over on the other side, and it was rough stuff. You didn't throw me off--

lines: How did we kill you? I don't even remember.

speaker: Maarvy
lines: You didn't throw me off a cliff or nothing. I'm too tough for that. You cut me in half!

lines: Oh! Yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah. Sorry. It didn't register. It wasn't even that big-- it wasn't even in my top 10 kills.

speaker: Maarvy

lines: This is the new-- Ladies and gentlemen, this is the new Merle… Highchurch. He casts Dispel Magic on his friend Taako to try to get rid of this Confusion that he has. And with Dispel Magic, you choose one creature, he is a creature, so he -- chooses him--

lines: I doubt that's how he prefers to be referred to, is as a creature-- unless that was his nickname in college.

lines: We need to reward our initiatives. That's okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Next in the order is Carey. Carey reaches into her pocket and pulls out what looks like a little white pebble that she throws upwards into the air, and it starts emitting this flashing light, and it kind of like hangs in the air emitting this strobe light. And your eyes are kind of like naturally drawn to it, and so are your robotic opponents. And when your eyes kind of adjust as this thing stops blinking and these robots are still kind of looking up at it, you see Carey almost like hanging in midair with her arms outstretched with two daggers, one dagger in each hand, which she brings down in a cross-chop on Maarvy's back. And [dice] (Clint Wow.) --very successfully performs a sneak attack on Maarvy for, [dice] Jesus, [more dice] for 28 points of damage.

lines: What?!

speaker: Griffin
lines: She buries her two blades in his back.

lines: [sighs] Should've been a rogue.

lines: You see a shower of sparks shoot out of these two wounds, giving him almost-- spark wings, and she does a backflip off of his back and lands behind him.

speaker: Clint
lines: By the way, if I may say, good move adding characters who are proficient at combat to our group.

lines: Hey, suck a nut! [Griffin and Justin laugh] I don't know if you remember, one time I kicked somebody out of a train!

lines: Okay, with an 8, you are going to use your action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there's no creature within its reach, the creature does nothing this turn.

lines: Cool.

lines: So within your reach, let me think. Magnus just rushed up... I think it would only be Merle, is the only thing that would be nearby you. 'Cause Carey just flipped behind the thing and Magnus ran up there. So go ahead and make a melee attack on Merle.

lines: [laughs] Yeah, I've been waiting for this! [dice] Uh, what we got there is a--

lines: Um…

lines: Alright, fine. [blows at flaming arm]

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can blow on it on your turn. Or maybe Jenkins will blow on it, because it's Jenkins' turn. Jenkins looks at how bad off Maarvy is and casts Stoneskin. Let me tell you what Stoneskin does, because I know you're wondering. It's like a-- so let me explain. In this game, clerics can cast buffs on the other members of their party, to like, make 'em more survivable, and keep 'em from getting hurt and taking damage or making them more-- it's like a really good thing that clerics can do. This is the first time you're learning this information.

lines: Yes!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You solved my 'thing you've been able to do for literally over a year now' puzzle.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I did it by completely obliterating three of the most beloved NPCs we've ever had on the show! [laughs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hey, maybe they'll come back, there's always a possib-- no, they're done.

speaker: Clint
lines: No. They're gone.

speaker: Travis
lines: Let's move forward down the pipe where we were going on the conveyor belt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, yeah, you--

speaker: Justin
lines: When we got stopped by these nerds.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah… [stammers]

speaker: Travis
lines: Also, Carey's been really quiet, could Carey say something like, great job, guys!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, is she kind of stunned by my obliterations?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, she's actually pretty blown away, she's like,

speaker: Carey
lines: Wow, Merle, I didn't know you had that in you! That was some savage shit!

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah! I didn't either!

speaker: Magnus
lines: … I did kill all three of them.

speaker: Merle
lines: No you didn't!

speaker: Carey
lines: Yeah, no, Magnus, you did a great job too, I mean, I definitely--

speaker: Magnus
lines: I destroyed the robit bodies.

speaker: Carey
lines: I definitely loosened the lid of that there pickle jar, but let's-- you know what? Let's just split the-- we'll split it four ways, we all did-- Oh, sorry, five-- five ways, Noelle, sorry...

speaker: Griffin
lines: Noelle, actually, is being extremely quiet. Noelle hasn't actually said anything this whole time since the three ghost robots showed up. And she is just kinda floating sullenly [Travis Oh, wait a minute…] away from you down the tunnel with her flashlight on.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Pst! Guys! Noelle's a spirit in a robot body!

speaker: Merle
lines: Ohhhhh man.

speaker: Magnus
lines: She's got the fuse! She's gotta be real bummed out about this news!

speaker: Merle
lines: Taako, go talk to her.

speaker: Noelle
lines: C'mon, guys, we gotta… we gotta move on, we're almost- we’re almost there.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Noelle... [Noelle Yeah?] I recognize now that you are a spirit, in a fuse, in a robot body, but I want you to know that I appreciate you as a member of this team, you've helped us a lot--

speaker: Noelle
lines: [crosstalk] I can't-- I don't-- I don't know what you-- I really don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, whenever you're ready.

speaker: Taako
lines: I mean, holistically speaking, you've gone from being a sentient AI to being a soul trapped in a machine... I think it's a zero-sum game, [Magnus Yeah] you didn't have any illusions about your own agency, right?

speaker: Noelle
lines: Is this like, funny? Is this, like–[Magnus No!] are you joking about this?

speaker: Taako
lines: What? No, I'm not joking, I mean, I, I mean, you thought you were a robot before, right? [heavy silence] ...Oh, no.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says, um... [trails off]

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, gosh. Okay. Someone's really stepped in the old spectral doo-doo now, eh? Um hm...

speaker: Noelle
lines: I-- I did-- I did-- I died. [“Hogsbottom” starts to play]-- She’s like-- Oh my God, I'm remembering now. I-- I-- my name is Noelle Redcheek. My family runs a cider press out in- out in Hogsbottom. I was ridin' our donkey into town and I was making a delivery to some dive bar, the… it was The Sleeping Giant. And it was in town, in Phandalin. And we heard--

speaker: Merle
lines: Never heard of it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: No.

speaker: Taako
lines: Nope.

speaker: Noelle
lines: And we heard screams from outside and there was this man, he came downstairs, he called himself- called himself Bluejeans. [Magnus gasps] And he was- he was so kind, he told us to hide in the stockroom and he-- he-- he hid us and he fought off this dwarf that was on fire, and he got him out of the bar and we thought we were safe. And then the whole world got burned up.

speaker: Merle
lines: That sucks. That is bad news.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah. Woof. Woof. Whoo. Hate to hear that, you know. I’m so sorry.

speaker: Merle
lines: Ah, too bad.

speaker: Magnus
lines: But what matters now is that you're technically alive.

speaker: Merle
lines: Well, no, not technically...

speaker: Magnus
lines: No, literally, technically. She, you're in a techno body so you're technically alive.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She actually starts laughing.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She's like, [laughs awkwardly]

speaker: Noelle
lines: I'm sorry, I just- Sorry, I just remembered, I was in that back room and everything was getting burned up, and I remember my last thought was that the whole world was getting destroyed. And the fact that I'm here, and y'all are still here... I thought the world was ending, I thought my whole family was gone, but the world's still here, right? It's still here!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yep!

speaker: Merle
lines: Phandalin not so much...

speaker: Taako
lines: Let's parse the question. Was your family in Phandalin?

speaker: Noelle
lines: No, they're out in Hogsbottom.

speaker: [crosstalk as the characters react with relief, "Yeah, you're good," "They're okay then," etc.]
Noelle
lines: Do y'all know what happened to Phandalin?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh, no... I heard-- you just said that it burned? It burned-- you-- I think-- You said that, right? That was you? Yeah.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, yeah.

speaker: Taako
lines: [choosing words carefully] We are part of the people that try to keep things like what happened in Phandalin from happening. [Merle Yeah, yeah, yeah.] We have... a pretty good success rate, if you count-- if you don't count that one, which, we can all agree, was a world-class boner. [Clint laughing] Now, if you want to keep what happened to you from happening to other people, it is imperative that you aid us down here in completing our mission.

speaker: Magnus
lines: In this. In this thing now.

speaker: Noelle
lines: You're saying that this thing that's turning this lab to crystal is trying to do to the world like what happened in Phandalin?

speaker: Taako
lines: You can save the world, Noelle.

speaker: Noelle
lines: Okay. All right then. Let's fuck 'em up.

speaker: Taako
lines: Heeeell yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The fuse pops out of her chest. Pops out of the bot. And it seems to be floating in midair, not like smoothly-- it's almost like the spirit inside it is pushing up on it, like, imagine a bird sort of like moving its birdcage just by flying really hard into the top of it. This is like an extreme amount of effort that this soul is using to push its fuse upward into the air. And you see it move its way over into the pile of parts that you left on the floor that were the robots whose asses you just kicked. And she floats into the big gorilla suit's body [Clint Oh, yeah.] and you see that mech, you see that robot stand up and pick up the wires and sort of tie it around its back and you see it pick up one of the arms left over from Magic Brian's robot, and strap that onto itself, and take some of the plating off that one, and take some of the plating off the old Noelle bot--

speaker: Justin
lines: And I throw the Buster arm and say,

speaker: Taako
lines: Take-- Let's go to fuck-up town!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see a fucking port open on this robot's side that catches that Buster arm in mid-air. And these four robots combine fuckin' Voltron style with Noelle in the middle of it. And she says

speaker: Noelle
lines: Hero time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: --and cocks her gun arm.
